WRITING.TEXT: Yeah, haha - just venting after a long day dealing with armchair critics :-)
Happy to have entertained! Say hi to your brother for me, and thanks for the viewership all the years ago :)

If was making money like I was in 2012/2013? No problem, I'd hire a co-host. But therein lies the problem; revenues are way down, so I can't afford to improve my content like I know is required. Very circular issues :(

*I think it's also extremely interesting that Jon's channel is appearently around the 50th YouTube channel ever created. That's really cool.*
/Jon is actually the OLDEST ACTIVE channel on all of YouTube! The 49 in front of me are all -actually- dead.
Anyway, that's awesome that you liked my Google+ rant that much! I actually kind of hate that video myself, haha. Poor quality, and poorly-constructed argument. Not my best, but one of my more visible. Picked up a LOT of Twitter followers from that :)
Appreciate the support, friend :)
Good luck on your quest! Leave me some comments to read along the way :)
They're still there, go back and watch! I actually still earn ad revenue on some of them :-/
Still do! New episode of "Movie Night" came out last night :)
Hahaha, and I probably corrected you, "I'm not Jory." :)

Me too man, me too :)
Thanks for being such an awesome fan all these years!
I loved those little moments on the show :)

It makes sense that you lose views because that's not what your channel exploded with.
But... I didn't. The channel's *best* three years was the period AFTER Microwave's retirement. Like, I get the point people are making - but NOBODY understands my audience / analytics / career better than me. And by offering advice, you are implying your level of understanding is somehow parallel to my own (whether intentional or not) - and it's something I see as disrespectful and ignorant.
To be clear, that's the royal 'you' - not speaking to you directly :)
Lol, yeah, he did. I hope he's matured a bit since then! Haha.

Typical Reddit. I receive all of the blame for "ending" the Microwave show, but none of the credit for creating it. And of course, when I try to defend myself in threads like this, I'm a "smug loser" who's "hilarious defensive". But if I don't engage, I'm a "coward afraid of criticism". Damned if you don't... damned if you do...

Sure, but it's tricky finding someone who wants to work for free, and can commute to my house, haha.
And no, it was Jory's idea to end "Microwave". Didn't want the show getting stale.
Glad to hear that :)
Thanks for saying so :)
That's cool to hear! Thanks for your viewership over the years!

I have, twice!
Might do a third soon. Have a very unique new supercut video coming out in April I'd like to promote. I only hope the AMA goes a little more positive than this thread :-/
You're welcome! Still use that same HD camera every day to film new stuff! One of the BEST investments I've ever made.
Huh? Haha - I've been doing movie reviews since years before "Microwave" even existed. Certainly a much more natural fit for me than Jackass-style science experiments, haha.
Awesome, glad to hear this. Thank you :)
THANKS! Glad to see some "Movie Night" fans in here :-)

Sorry you had the experience, honestly. I've matured a lot since then. I'd be happy to unblock you and have a real conversation if you genuinely wanted to. Otherwise, thanks for your support all those years back. You are missed.

Getting the gang together with any regularity is next to impossible these days. Especially that money and shit is involved too.
I had to find ways to create content by myself, and I agree - it doesn't have that "spark" :(

It's even worse from my side, haha.
I get all of the blame for ending "Microwave", and none of the credit for creating it. Classic Reddit :)
Old schoolers represent!

I was making a semantic argument, not a practical one :)
We had little audience before TMS, but my point stands - the channel is not "microwave content", it is "Variety".
Appreciate your loyalty and support! Means a lot :)

"Meltdown"... "useful advice"? - Are we reading the same thread? Hahah.
I'm genuinely curious to hear why you think I "don't do that well", though...
Ouch.
Good news! Both shows will return this month ;-)
I never suggested I "wouldn't live" - merely trying to frame my "hilariously defensive" behavior. Thanks for piling on though!
LOL, who would pretend to be me? Haha.
Both. I go into our decision a bit more here, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2I2lJRHais8
You're very welcome! Appreciate your support, thank you :)

*People have the right to say what they do or don't like.*
I don't like this conversation.

Yeah, of course. Jory, not as much as I'd like (he doesn't have a car, and lives 40 minutes away) - but I talk to Riley on the phone like 3x a week. Was just chatting this morning about the new Yooka-Laylee game.
I've only heard this once or twice myself, so it couldn't have been a very big rumor...

marked your downward spiral in views
Actually, I saw a nice up-tick in traffic in the three years following Microwave's retirement. 2011-2013 were my best years. As for motivation? Do it for joy and money - and Microwave wasn't providing either. "Movie Night" was WAY more profitable, and much more challenging, creatively. Also gave me time to focus on other shows, too.
As for movie reviews? Might as well just watch my newest from last night, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y-ybJ6QquJU - it could use the viewership, haha. Leave a comment, let me know what you think - I still read 'em all :)

You'd have to ask him, honestly. He never liked the work/grind, honestly. His commitment to Microwave was always extremely small. He was happy to host, but hated all the other stuff associated with growing / maintaining a channel. My best guess, anyway.

it was just a bad idea to completely change your channel's content
And yet, no one complained when I switched from comedy sketches to microwave content. Funny, huh? Jogwheel is, and *always has been* a VARIETY channel. Currently, it's home to five separate shows. When Microwave was running, three or four. When FOX canceled Arrested Development no one accused them of "completely changing" their content - because that doesn't make any fucking sense.
As for your other suggestions? It just proves how misinformed you are - because I already have "separate channels" and I already tried the 'slowed down' schedule as well.
Again. **Thank you for the insight, but I did not ask for it.**

because you probably already know this and I'm wasting my time
Ding ding ding. But, to your earlier advice, you may not have been implying it was easy, but the fact that you brought it up at all seems to imply that I need to hear it. As if I wasn't already aware of how YouTube works, etc. That's all.
As for Emile - he's an enigma. He has cultivated a VERY particular and loyal fanbase, and has stuck laser-focused to a very particular niche without any wavering. I couldn't do that. I'd be bored and unchallenged.
Thank you for the insight.

Yeah, it really isn't - I've diversified a lot in the past 3 years in anticipation of that. Would love more help on Patreon, but I don't like promoting it :(
Merch, though... I've got www.ThatReference.com - but sales are slow. My audience just doesn't buy shit. Gotta grab that teen-girl demo!
Awesome, I appreciate that. Thank you. Have a good 'fools day :)
My hair-game is [much better](https://www.instagram.com/p/BQ_tD8chgCb/) now!

Other channels are doing just fine
The old ones? From 2006/2007? Mostly all see little returns, re: subs vs. views: MakeMeBad35, WhatTheBuck, EpicMealTime, MysteryGuitarMan, Pogobat, VenetianPrincess, SMPFilms, WheezyWaiter, Gunnarolla, MitchellDavis, et. all
And, AGAIN, "*you have to find out what algorithm they are currently using and tune your channel to it.*" is MUCH easier said than done. Lots of people think they understand what it takes to be successful on YouTube. But very few have actually done it. And a microscopic amount have done it for 10+ years. It isn't easy.
Thanks for the chat.

Well, that is likely because I am defense, and generally rather arrogant, haha. I've never really disputed that. I always respond to my audience, and if they're polite and friendly - I do my best to reply in-kind.
Again though, natural reaction after dealing with little shits on the internet second-guessing every decision you've ever made for 11 years running...
It's also entirely possible I said something I forget. That happens with alarming regularity as well, haha.

LOL, as if someone would pretend to be me!
(yes)

Haha, of course. We were pretty good IRL friends for a hot couple of years back then. But he's moved away from the YouTube scene, so I don't see him at conventions anymore. Still produces political-content though.
He was in a bad place last time I saw him (during his "Dan 3.0 meltdown")... but I should reconnect with him, he's a cool guy. Too smart for YouTube, honestly.

"Dangerous", etc. I fought against the YouTube team years ago for many months, to little avail. All our best-performing videos now don't earn any money. And they never attracted outside revenue like sponsors, either.
"Movie Night", however...

Hope you are well.
After this thread? I've been better. All the top-comments seem to be raking me over the coals, haha. But thanks for the support! Means a lot.
"Healthy sarcasm"? Haha, you flatter me. My sarcastic behavior is practically unbearable to most, lol.
Incredibly. Unlike those other YouTubers who ignore their audience entirely!
Technically, it "turned into" a microwave channel. Used to be comedy sketches. Funny how no one ever complained about that transformation ;)

... wait, so you're suggesting I'm *not* a "smug loser"?
/ ^(genuinely confused)
And those Microwave videos earn $0 since they're *all* age-restricted. That show was not sustainable long-term.

Oh, hahahaha. If it only it were that easy! YouTube's algorithms (OneChannel, WatchTime) have crippled my channel's ability to deliver content to those 845,000 subs. Doesn't matter if we came back with some huge Microwave-reunion special, it'd top out at like 20,000 views (which would be way above average these days) - but that's it.
Only way my content gets above 3% viewership anymore is if it gets traction off-site, like Reddit.
For what it's worth though, I really felt like "Don't Eat The Spam" was my next "unique and interesting" show. It returns with s3 this month, but I don't expect much success.
And I will tell *him* that you said this!
You try watching again with the subtitles on then, haha :)

Sucked punched them in a Baltimore alley, and stole their YouTube password. Never looked back.
(^(yes))

So, I switched from doing movie reviews, comedy sketches, microwave videos, news/rants, and travel vlogs to doing movie reviews, comedy sketches, let's plays, news/rants, and travel vlogs?
It is completely different, you're right!

Haha, you'd be surprised!
While I apparently created everyone's favorite "early YouTube" show, I'm simultaneously a "smug" "loser" who ruined everything that's happened since. Reddit is impossible to please **shrug*
Awesome, glad to hear that! After many setbacks (and losing an entire night of footage which *really* bummed me out) -- I'm pleased to share new episodes of DETS should air this month :)
I watch every video on that channel!

Huh? When was I dick to anyone in this thread? Defensive, sure - but I haven't insulted anyone or been rude... I politely asked /u/kutjepiemel how my material compares to some vanilla-reviewer like Stuckmann.
But yeh, frequency / consistency is very difficult to maintain. One of my biggest problems, admittedly. But even when I haul ass and produced 10+ videos a week, I see no solid returns on my work at all. There's no incentive to stick to a schedule or produce more content. Not anymore, anyway.
... not sure if joking.

Twice, actually!
JPizzle1122 ideoProductions Jogwheel.

It does. Thank you :)
Shh... you're ruining the illusion. Reddit's definition of "dead" just means *"channel I stopped watching*".
We collaborated on a video *way* back when... haven't heard much from him in a while. I think we spoke on Twitter a couple years ago.

There's been chatter about 'revamping' it since before we announced its retirement. Comes entirely down to resources, and Jory's willingness (he's always been very reluctant to go back to that well).
As for "The World According To Jon" - the internet has ruined that show for me. Interactions not too dissimilar from this thread have completely killed any desire I have to share my opinion on anything controversial anymore, so I rarely do. That said, I did just do a video on the healthcare bill failure last week, which came out pretty well I thought.
370+, actually! In terms of episode-count, it's my 2nd-most prolific show behind my LP series, "Game Time". Appreciate the well-wishes, truly. Thank you.
Fair enough.
Has your entire career ever been insulted and criticized by a pack of upset strangers on the internet before? For six years straight?
Thank you for the feedback. Very helpful. Totally not condescending or misinformed.

I'm glad you've moved onto other things you're passionate about though.
Too bad you and me are like the only ones who share this opinion, haha :)
"TMS" was our shorthand abbreviation of "The Microwave Show". Much easier to type than, "Is It A Good Idea To Microwave This?":)
Well, how might I make my reviews "interesting / funny / great"? How am I any less "interesting / funny great" from someone like Chris Stuckmann?
Shh... don't tell anyone this, but... ^it ^never ^was.
**Stopping *Stopping*

He said that there would be some microwave stuff throughout 2016
I did?

come up with another consistently entertaining and unique idea
Lol. You make it sound so easy. "Just became YouTube-famous twice! Anyone can do it."

*I'm still pretty sure you'd be getting more views if you were doing that.*
There's no way that formula would be sustainable for that long. It was getting repetitive after 2 years, let alone 10. In the years since its retirement, I've had several videos 'go viral' - none were "Microwave". Despite Reddit's rose-colored glasses, that show just never grabbed large outside audiences (or profit).
But moreover, TMS still exists - it wasn't deleted. There's 370+ episodes the "kids" of 2017 can, and still do watch it all the time :)
Not great, honestly. That audience grew up. Apparently, Reddit hasn't.

You make us sound like unhinged maniacs, but yes - that was us, haha.
Appreciate the support, thanks.
Appreciate that, you're very welcome!

Have you seen "[Don't Eat The Spam](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EyW0iL1-VmI)" though? I've found that most people who say, "I'm not a fan anymore" are usually those who aren't familiar with half the stuff I actually produce these days...

Jory wanted to retire the show before it became "stale". I pushed for two more seasons (9 and 10), and then we agreed to end it on a high note. The show was tough to produce, expensive, and not creatively fulfilling. And, perhaps most importantly - kept getting flagged / age-restricted by YouTube. And since no sponsor ever wanted to touch the show, it wasn't ever very profitable. And contrary to Reddit's rose-colored glasses, it never went 'viral', either - it took MANY years to build our modest, devoted audience. Moving on seemed like a good move.
I'm glad I tried other things - the years following were by far my most successful. We had a great four years though! 10 year anniversary is coming up soon!
Thank you :)
Ah, Mike LaPorte. Haven't heard you insult me in a long time... how ya been?
I will tell him you said this. Haha.
Appreciate the feedback! I'll try to make it less '*sucks*' going forward.
Rockingham county, represent :)
I didn't mean to hurt you. I'm sorry that I made you cry.
Well, you got me there.
Wow! Thanks man, I really appreciate that.
Good luck! Feel free to leave some comments along your binge, I still read 'em all :)

You're very welcome!
Appreciate the support all these years later, really does mean a lot.

Appreciate the insight. But yeh, very few people see the situation for what it was. If we were still microwaving shit in 2017? I'd be the top answer another thread, "What YouTube channels never evolved or grew up?"
And fewer still realize that it was actually Jory who wanted to end Microwave, not me. He wanted to retire after 8 seasons, I pushed for 2 more. Ultimately, we both agreed it was the right decision.
I'm actually quite proud of those '[shriveled up movie reviews](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y-ybJ6QquJU)' :-)
Some might say I still am...
Woah. You're old-school! Created the "Dynamite" episode for a college assignment, we only had like 5,000 subscribers at the time. Nice to meet an old fan!
I'm not denying it 'tanked' - I'm arguing that the cause behind the 'tanking' is not related to the retirement of the Microwave show.
... I didn't 'tank my channel' though. Hahah. My best / most profitable years were 2012 + 2013. A year AFTER Microwave ended.
But I'm not dead yet!
Thanks man. Really. I needed some positivity in this thread.
Of course!
Hahaha, thanks man. Good chat.

Yeah, I know - it's fucking awful. That viewership decline has nothing to do with the retirement of *one* of my 16 shows over five years ago. I mean honestly, if I was still microwaving shit? I'd hear the exactly opposite argument; "you need to grow up - this shit is old and stale!"
I liked 'em too! Lots of legal / financial / safety / personal hurdles got in the way of a potential 3rd season though :(

Well, you said "majority of your fanbase". As a creator, that's not exclusive to any specific channel or show.
But, if we remove my side channels from the equation, more than half of Jogwheel's subscribers have originated from non-Microwave content. Sorry to disappoint.

Well, for that user, I did exactly that. I'm heading your advice.

YouTube Analytics.
Were you under the impression I didn't know where my own audience came from?

I accept criticism quite readily, actually. It's hearing uninformed theories and insults masquerading as 'feedback' that bothers me.

is "criticism" I should be learning to "accept".

I definitely don't deny that. I love a good argument!

That formula is not sustainable though. I've had videos hit Reddit and 'go viral'. It's good for a half a day of exposure, at best. And how do you even keep track of what the internet likes? If this site is any indication, our interests evaporate quicker than a fart in the wind.
TOO LATE. I'm already in the house.
